isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000i, 9000i - REMOVE - REMOVE HOOD SEALS

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cowl Hood Seal on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i (SFA), 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood

step1.para: Unlatch fiberglass tilt hood on both sides and raise hood to full open position.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 39 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cowl hood seal (Item 1) from cowl tray (Item 2) by pulling it off cowl tray flange starting at one end or the other. Save the cowl hood seal for installation, if not damaged.

figure.caption: Figure 39. Remove Hood Seals on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i (SFA), 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cowl Hood Seal on 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood

step1.para: Unlatch hood latches on both sides and raise driver or passenger side hood to full open position as required.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cowl hood seal (Item 1) from cowl tray (Item 2) by starting at one end or the other and pulling it carefully off the cowl tray flange (Item 3). Save the cowl hood seal for installation, if not damaged.

figure.caption: Figure 40. Remove Cowl Hood Seal and Radiator Shell Hood Seals on 5600 i (SBA) with Butterfly Hood

calloutgroup.callout1: 6. SHEET METAL SCREW AND FLAT WASHER
9. SHEET METAL SCREW AND FLAT WASHER
14. FOURTH AND FIFTH HOLES ON RADIATOR SHELL FLANGE
15. FIRST AND SECOND HOLES ON RADIATOR SHELL SIDE FLANGE

svcsubproc.title: Remove Radiator Shell Hood Seals on 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove both radiator shell hood seals (Item 4) from the radiator shell flange (Item 5), remove two sheet metal screws and flat washers (Item 6, view in circle A) and remove both seal pad brackets with seal pads (Items 7 and 8, view in circle A) from the top of the radiator shell. Remove two sheet metal screws and flat washers (Item 9, view in circle B) and remove seal pad bracket with seal pad (Items 10 and 11, view in circle B) from the side of the radiator shell, driver side shown. Repeat for passenger side. Save sheet metal screws and flat washers for installation, if not damaged.

If it is necessary to replace seal pad (Item 8, view in circle A) on seal pad bracket (Item 7, view in circle A) or seal pad (Item 11, view in circle B) on seal pad bracket (Item 10, view in circle B), remove two push-in fasteners (Item 13, view in circle A and circle B) and remove it from seal pad bracket (Item 7, view in circle A) or (Item 10, view in circle B). Save push-in fasteners for installation, if not damaged.
Remove both radiator shell hood seals (Item 4) by carefully pulling on hood seals at each push-in fastener to remove them. Save hood seals for installation, if not damaged.
